pros: Skilled clinicians, caring managers, excellent benefits, wonderful colleagues, team approach to patient care, dedicated staff, fun atmosphere, great support from Mental Health Coordinators, meaningful work, flexible schedules, everyone really is committed to improving the health of our patients & community, dedicated to diversity, core values are justice, equity, clinical excellence, compassion, respect, partnership, & responsiveness, you feel valued & respected working here, advancement opportunities
cons: Pay may be less than other settings

review_title: Awesome staff with lots of diversity
job_title: Dental Assistant in Santa Rosa, CA
pros: The staff here is amazing! I have made a lot of good friends here. I also appreciate the diversity here. The pay and benefits are good. Union dues are high, but worth it because we often need the union to advocate for us with the the management and leadership.
cons: This used to be an amazing place to work, but without strong leadership and management over the last year, the work culture has suffered. Many of us are no longer going above and beyond because we are tired, turnover is high, and we are understaffed all the time.

job_title: Registered Nurse in Santa Rosa, CA
pros: Decent benefits, fantastic coworkers, great learning environment, paid holidays, room for growth/opportunities within the organization
cons: Low hourly pay for amount of work tasked to do, employees that have been in the organization for many years deserve a little more recognition than just a pin.

review_title: Busy, did not always feel supported
cons: I felt like management was not always direct. I did not always feel supported and often felt overwhelmed.

pros:
The providers are awesome people.
Learned new things about different communities.
cons: I was treated very poorly by my peers when I was hired. I would actually call it "verbally abused"everyday. I reported this several times to my supervisor and nothing was done. In fact, the supervisor was often absent and left the abusers to run the clinic. Also, they hired a lunatic doctor to work there for about 6 months. She caused a lot of problems for the employees and patients. She had and still has pending malpractice lawsuits against her. She was very unhealthy for the environment and they chose to keep her regardless.

job_title: Behavioral Health Clinician in Santa Rosa, CA
pros: Funky, fun atmosphere.  Off-beat folks committed to making health care accessible to all. I love that the clinic has a strong commitment to the health of women and children.
cons: Change comes slowly, but it does come.  The culture of this clinic is changing to be a patient centered medical home and this is taking a lot of work and not every provider is on board, but I can see it happening and it is very exciting.

review_title: Good People, Good Mission, Good Work
job_title: Anonymous Employee in Santa Rosa, CA
pros: Sense of community, nice benefits package, forward thinking and growing, leadership aligned with mission and values, opportunities for growth & development. Positive people dedicated to making a difference while also having a little fun.
cons: Some lack of organization and consistency   with regard to systems (policies, procedures, electronic health record data & reporting)

review_title: Nurse Care Manager, providing complex care pt assistance navigating their health care outside of the hospital
job_title: Nurse Care Manager in Santa Rosa, CA
pros: 8-5 schedule, weekends and major holidays off, great ambiance around the whole company, good job security, room for improvement and assistance in doing so
cons: Low pay compared to inpt nursing, no chance for overtime, no monetary bonuses, low pt case load, little clinical duties performed

pros: We have  staff that is not valued by management.  Compensation and benefits are good because of the union.
